name: cfftp
description: Lets users implement File Transfer Protocol (FTP) operations.

params.name: action
params.description:
FTP operation to perform.
 open: create an FTP connection
 close: terminate an FTP connection

params.name: username
params.description: Overrides username specified in ODBC setup.

params.name: password
params.description: Overrides password specified in ODBC setup.

params.name: server
params.description:
FTP server to which to connect; for example,
 ftp.myserver.com

params.name: timeout
params.description:
Value in seconds for the timeout of all operations,
 including individual data request operations.

params.name: port
params.description: Remote port to which to connect

params.name: connection
params.description:
Name of the FTP connection. If you specify the username,
 password, and server attributes, and if no connection
 exists for them, CFML creates one. Calls to cfftp
 with the same connection name reuse the connection.

params.name: proxyserver
params.description: The proxy server required to access the URL.

params.name: retrycount
params.description: Number of retries until failure is reported.

params.name: stoponerror
params.description:
Yes: halts processing, displays an appropriate error.
 No: populates the error variables

params.name: passive
params.description: Yes: enable passive mode

params.name: transfermode
params.description:
ASCII FTP transfer mode
 Binary FTP transfer mode
 Auto FTP transfer mode

params.name: failifexists
params.description: Yes: if a local file with same name exists, getFile fails

params.name: directory
params.description: Directory on which to perform an operation

params.name: localfile
params.description: Name of the file on the local file system

params.name: remotefile
params.description: Name of the file on the FTP server file system.

params.name: item
params.description: Object of these actions: file or directory.

params.name: existing
params.description: Current name of the file or directory on the remote server.

params.name: new
params.description: New name of file or directory on the remote server

params.name: name
params.description: Query name of directory listing.

params.name: result
params.description:
Specifies a name for the structure in which cfftp
 stores the returnValue variable. If set, this value
 replaces cfftp as the prefix to use when accessing
 returnVariable.

params.name: attributes
params.description: Attributes of the current element: normal or Directory.

params.name: passphrase
params.description: CF8+ Used when `key` is specified. Because private keys are stored in an encrypted form on the client host, the user must supply a passphrase to enable generating the signature.

params.name: buffersize
params.description: Buffer size in bytes.

params.name: secure
params.description: CF8+ `yes`: enables secure FTP

params.name: asciiextensionlist
params.description:
Delimited list of file extensions that force ASCII
 transfer mode, if transferMode = "auto".

params.name: key
params.description:
CF8+ Public-key-based authentication. Refers to the absolute path to the private key of the user. 
Possession of a private key provides authentication by sending a signature created with a private key. 
The server must ensure that the key is a valid authentication for the user and that the signature is valid. 
Both must be valid to accept the authentication.

params.name: actionparam
params.description: Used only when action is quote, site, or acct. Specifies the command when action is quote or site; specifies account information when action is acct.

params.name: fingerprint
params.description: CF8+ Fingerprint of the host key in the form ssh-dss.ssh-rsa, which is a 16-byte unique identifier for the server attribute that you specify.

params.name: systemtype
params.description: CF11.0.3+ Specifies how to parse file list response, specify `WINDOWS` or `UNIX` or a class which implements `org.apache.commons.net.ftp.FTPFileEntryParser`

lucee.notes: Lucee does not support authentication by public key.

links.title: Use of systemtype attribute
links.description: Describes and documents the systemtype attribute which was added in CF11 update 3.

examples.title: Script Syntax
examples.description: CF9+ using the CFIDE script components

examples.title: Open Connection
examples.code: <cfftp action="open" connection="myConn" username="myUName" password="myPW" server="ftp.server.com" stopOnError="true">
